solution_line_template: Aisha starts with {initial_songs} songs + {added_first_week} songs = <<{initial_songs}+{added_first_week}={songs_after_first_two_weeks}>>{songs_after_first_two_weeks} songs added to her mp3 player in the first two weeks.

After that Aisha adds twice that amount to her mp3 player, {songs_after_first_two_weeks} x {multiplier_twice} = <<{songs_after_first_two_weeks}*{multiplier_twice}={songs_added_twice_amount}>>{songs_added_twice_amount} songs added.

She now has {songs_after_first_two_weeks} + {songs_added_twice_amount} = <<{songs_after_first_two_weeks}+{songs_added_twice_amount}={total_songs_before_removal}>>{total_songs_before_removal} songs on her mp3 player.

However, she decides she wants to remove {songs_to_remove} of them, {total_songs_before_removal} - {songs_to_remove} = <<{total_songs_before_removal}-{songs_to_remove}={final_songs}>>{final_songs} songs on her mp3 player.
